problem: Let $p(x) = 2x - 7$ and $q(x) = 3x - b$.  If $p(q(4)) = 7$, what is $b$?
solution: Since $q(4) = 3\cdot 4 - b = 12-b$, we can write $p(q(4)) = 7$ as $p(12-b) = 7$.  Since $p(x) = 2x-7$, we have $p(12-b) = 2(12-b) - 7 = 17 - 2b$. Substituting this into $p(12-b) = 7$ gives $17-2b =7$, from which we have $b = \boxed{5}$.
model_solution:
Step 1: Calculate q(4) using the given expression q(x) = 3x - b.
q(4) = 3(4) - b
q(4) = 12 - b
Step 2: Evaluate p(q(4)) by substituting q(4) into the expression p(x) = 2x - 7.
p(q(4)) = 2(q(4)) - 7
p(q(4)) = 2(12 - b) - 7
Step 3: Simplify the expression p(q(4)) = 2(12 - b) - 7
p(q(4)) = 24 - 2b - 7
p(q(4)) = 17 - 2b
Substitute the expression for p(q(4)) into the equation p(q(4)) = 7.
24 - 2b = 7
Subtract 24 from both sides.
-2b = -17
Divide both sides by -2.
b = 17/2
Divide both sides by -2 to solve for b.
b = -17/-2
b = 17/2

Step 1: Calculate q(4) using the given expression q(x) = 3x - b.
q(4) = 3(4) - b
q(4) = 12 - b

Step 2: Evaluate p(q(4)) by substituting q(4) into the expression p(x) = 2x - 7.
p(q(4)) = 2(q(4)) - 7
p(q(4)) = 2(12 - b) - 7

Step 3: Simplify the expression p(q(4)) = 2(12 - b) - 7
p(q(4)) = 24 - 2b - 7
p(q(4)) = 17 - 2b

Substitute the expression for p(q(4)) into the equation p(q(4)) = 7.
24 - 2b = 7

Divide both sides by -2 to solve for b.
b = -17/-2
